name: HyperCrop Batch Image Resizer
description:
The fastest way to batch crop/resize multiple images to multiple sizes from Figma.


Features


  • Use instantly inside Figma; no extra websites, apps or APIs required.
  • Insanely simple batch cropping multiple images to multiple sizes.
  • High precision manual crop tool for individual image cropping.
  • Automatic content aware and face detection smart crop features.
  • Specify the anchor focal point per image (eg. "Bottom/Center")
  • Includes quick size presets for social networks, platforms and devices.
  • Add your own custom crop sizes to the crop presets library, per Figma page.
  • Crop sizes, selections and options automatically saved in between uses.
  • Export to JPG/PNG with optional image compression for smaller file sizes.
  • Custom, dynamic filenames and subfolders (eg. "#{name}/#{width}x#{height}).


To use HyperCrop


  1. Install HyperCrop and run the plugin inside your project.
  2. Add all of the sizes that you want to crop your images to.
  3. Select the exportable images you would like to crop/resize.
  4. Optionally set any specific crop options per image.
  5. Click the Batch Crop button (or Crop Manually).
  6. Download and enjoy your cropped images!


Documentation & Video Tutorials


For plugin documentation and step by step video tutorials, please visit https://docs.figmatic.com/hypercrop


Bug Reports


HyperCrop is still a baby panda; if you notice any bugs, please get in touch via https://www.figmatic.com/contact and we'll publish a fix as soon as possible.


License


After you've tried cropping and resizing images with HyperCrop 15 times, you'll be asked to enter your license key. Your license key will allow you or your team to crop and resize an unlimited amount of images using HyperCrop.


To purchase a license or to find out more, please visit https://figmatic.com/hypercrop
